title: Eagles Injury Report: Jalen Carter on track to return, Lane Johnson misses practice
description: The latest news on Philadelphia and Buffalo.
fullText:
The Philadelphia Eagles issued their first official injury report in advance of their Week 17 road game against the Buffalo Bills.

The Eagles listed four players under DID NOT PARTICIPATE: Lane Johnson, A.J. Brown, Nakobe Dean, and Landon Dickerson.

For the second week in a row, there was a report about Johnson returning to practice but it‚Äôs yet to happen. Unless Lane Johnson returns to practice on Thursday, he‚Äôs probably out again this week.

Brown is listed with ‚Äúteeth‚Äù as his injury designation. More context below. Guessing he should be able to play.

A.J. Brown said yesterday that he was getting his wisdom teeth out this week, so that could be the reason for his absence. #Eagles https://t.co/W9TILDfNuu

‚Äî Jeff McLane (@Jeff_McLane) December 24, 2025

Vic Fangio suggested that Dean is unlikely to play on Sunday. Don‚Äôt want to rush him back from his hamstring injury, especially with Jihaad Campbell as a more than capable starting linebacker option.

Dickerson missed Wednesday‚Äôs practice due to illness. He‚Äôs been missing some practice sessions in recent weeks due to rest reasons.

The Eagles listed seven players under FULL PARTICIPATION: Jalen Carter, DeVonta Smith, Zack Baun, Jihaad Campbell, Fred Johnson, Cameron Latu, and Cameron Williams.

Carter told reporters he plans on returning to action on Sunday. It remains to be seen just how much the time off helped him.

Jalen Carter said he expects to play on Sunday. He had some shots in his shoulders before missing the last three weeks and is already feeling the benefits.

‚Äî Dave Zangaro (@DZangaroNBCS) December 24, 2025

Jalen Carter said he got multiple shots in both shoulders. He‚Äôs probably not going to feel 100% during this stretch run and will likely have to revisit the injury in the offseason.

‚Äî Jeff Neiburg (@Jeff_Neiburg) December 24, 2025

DeVonta, Baun, Campbell, and Fred Johnson were never in doubt.

Latu missed Week 16 due to a stinger. Seems like he might be able to return in Week 17.

Williams is still in his 21-day practice window to return from injured reserve but the Eagles don‚Äôt seem to be in a rush to replace him.

WR A.J. Brown (teeth)
LB Nakobe Dean (hamstring)
OG Landon Dickerson (illness)
OT Lane Johnson (foot)

LB Zack Baun (hand)
LB Jihaad Campbell (back/ankle)
DT Jalen Carter (shoulders)
OT Fred Johnson (ankle)
TE Cameron Latu (stinger)
WR DeVonta Smith (illness)
OT Cameron Williams (shoulder)

Note that this report is an estimation because the Bills held a walkthrough in lieu of a normal practice.

The Bills listed seven players under DID NOT PARTICIPATE: starting edge rusher Joey Bosa, starting defensive tackle DaQuan Jones, starting safety Jordan Poyer, starting tight end Dawson Knox, rotational tight end Dalton Kincaid, kicker Matt Prater, and depth defensive tackle (and dirty player) Jordan Phillips.

Bosa, who leads the Bills in TFLs and ranks second in sacks, previously missed time due to his hamstring injury but he was removed from the injury report in Week 16. It remains to be seen if this is a new hamstring injury or if it‚Äôs related to his previous one. Something to monitor.

Jones has previously been getting rest in practice so perhaps the Bills are taking it easy with him.

Poyer picked up a hammy injury during the Bills‚Äô Week 16 win. We‚Äôll see if the former Eagles UDFA signing is able to play.

Knox is a new addition to the Bills‚Äô injury report. If neither him nor Kincaid can play, the Bills will be without two of their top three tight ends.

Bills kicker Matt Prater is still hurt so Michael Badgley might have to kick in place of him again.

The Bills listed four players under LIMITED PARTICIPATION: starting quarterback Josh Allen, linebacker Shaq Thompson, starting nickel cornerback Taron Johnson, and backup nickel cornerback Cam Lewis.

All indications point to Allen playing but he might be less than 100%. We‚Äôll see if his mobility is impacted at all.

DE Joey Bosa (hamstring)
DT DaQuan Jones (calf)
TE Dalton Kincaid (knee)
TE Dawson Knox (knee)
DT Jordan Phillips (ankle)
S Jordan Poyer (hamstring)
K Matt Prater (right quad)

QB Josh Allen (foot)
CB Taron Johnson (quad)
DB Cam Lewis (hamstring)
LB Shaq Thompson (neck)

S Cole Bishop (ribs)
RB Ray Davis (knee)

title: Jerry Jones Hints at Cowboys International Game Coming 'Next Year'
description: The NFL is expecting each team to compete in an international game on a rotational basis. The Dallas Cowboys are due to appear in one, and it could come much sooner than later.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have not appeared in an international game since 2014, which is the longest active streak among any NFL franchise.

With the league now proposing that each team take part in a game on foreign soil at least once every eight years, the Cowboys are next in line to book a trip out of the country for a game. The new rule came about in 2022, so no agreements have been broken yet, but the Cowboys' worldwide fame is a bit surprising that no international exposure has been scheduled yet.

In 2014, it was Tony Romo and Dez Bryant who led a Cowboys team to a 31-17 win in London over the Jacksonville Jaguars. It was the franchise's first and only game played outside of the United States.

Cowboys owner Jerry Jones not only thinks Dallas' next international game is approaching, but that it could be south of the border as soon as next season. The NFL is already planning to host a game next season at Estadio Azeteca in Mexico City in 2026.

‚ÄúI think probably in the near time,‚Äù Jones said about the idea, ‚Äúwith near being next year.‚Äù

We've already looked at the Cowboys' potential 2026 schedule based on them being locked into the No. 2 placing in the NFC East. Dallas is scheduled to host nine games at AT&T Stadium and travel to eight road games.

One of those home contests would have to be sacrificed for an international game. If it comes in Mexico City, we figure that'd be as close to a home-like crowd as you can find outside of Arlington.

Whether it's in North America or Europe, the general expectation is for Dallas to be the home team in this one because they've been voided of the opportunity as a visitor in the past. Home teams in these games get to choose their opponent, and many are smart not to pick a team with such a large fanbase and global brand like the Cowboys with the risk of losing merchandising sales or in-stadium support.

According to ClutchPoints, Jones says that Dallas being the home team in order to score a game is "unavoidable under the current framework," because it's also they will have to rotationally give up a home game and compete internationally anyway.

With this in mind, don't be surprised if "America's Team" takes on foreign soil in the near future.

title: UFC 325 official poster: Alexander Volkanovski looms over Diego Lopes
description: The official poster for UFC 325 has been released ‚Äì and it's a lot of green for Volkanovski vs. Lopes 2.
fullText:
The UFC will kick off its new era with Paramount+ and CBS with two numbered events in January, and the second of those will come "Down Under" with UFC 325.

On Jan. 31 at Qudos Bank Arena in Sydney, featherweight champion Alexander Volkanovski will put his title on the line in a rematch with familiar foe Diego Lopes. The pair first met at UFC 314 in April, with "The Great" earning a unanimous decision victory to claim the vacant belt left behind by Ilia Topuria.

It will be Volkanovski's first appearance on home soil in nearly three years, and his first in Sydney since November 2017. Could Volkanovski (27-4 MMA, 14-3 UFC) be having his last stand against Lopes (27-7 MMA, 6-2 UFC), who is eager to avenge the loss after bouncing back with a highlight-reel finish of Jean Silva in September.

Promotional efforts for UFC 325 are underway. Volkanovski and Lopes had a faceoff at a seasonal press conference this month, and now the organization has released the official poster for the event, which sees the champion looming over the challenger with a heavy tint of green (via X):

A Christmas present for our fans Down Under!

The #UFC325 Poster just dropped - we'll see you in Sydney ü¶òüëä

[ LIVE on @ParamountPlus ] pic.twitter.com/1hUp5CXcCp

Alexander Volkanovski vs. Diego Lopes ‚Äì for featherweight title

Dan Hooker vs. Benoit Saint Denis

Rafael Fiziev vs. Mauricio Ruffy

title: Warriors' Steve Kerr apologizes for bench argument with Draymond Green
description: Warriors head coach Steve Kerr apologized for role in argument with Draymond Green during a third quarter timeout in Monday's win versus Orlando.
fullText:
It seems all is well between Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green and head coach Steve Kerr following a Monday argument during a third quarter timeout in their eventual 120-97 win against the Orlando Magic.

Kerr, during a press conference Wednesday, took accountability for the dust up that led to Green briefly walking away from the bench to gain his composure alone in the locker room before returning shortly before the fourth quarter began, despite never taking off his warmups.

"Monday night was not my finest hour and that was a time I needed to be calm in the huddle, and so I regret my actions in that exchange. I apologized to Dray. He apologized to me. We both apologized to the team."

Steve Kerr on Draymond Green: ‚ÄúMonday night was not my finest hour and that was a time I needed to be calm in the huddle, and so I regret my actions in that exchange. I apologized to Dray. He apologized to me. We both apologized to the team.‚Äù

‚Äî Joseph Dycus (@joseph_dycus) December 24, 2025

Green, a four-time champion in 13 seasons with the Warriors, said after Monday's game to reporters that "tempers spilled over".

"I just thought it was best that I get out of there," Green said. "I don't think it was a situation where it was going to get better, so it was best to remove myself."

The cause of the argument Green said was basketball.

"It's what we do," he said. "We play basketball. It's an emotional game. People lose their emotions sometimes, it happens. It is what it is. We've been at this now for a long time. Sometimes you're with people for a long time there's a level of comfort and it happens. We move forward."

Reporters on Monday asked if it was something that would linger on, but Green dismissed it saying they would "move forward".

"We'll move forward, we're alright," Green said regarding his spat with Kerr.

The Warriors are currently have a .500 record after 30 games, sitting at the eighth spot in the Western Conference. They have a Christmas Day game Thursday against the Dallas Mavericks and their rookie sensation Cooper Flagg at Chase Center in San Francisco.

"I think we're headed in the right direction," Green said to reporters Monday. "No one's happy about being 15-15. But I think we're starting to figure out different things, rotations and who we are as a team so I think that's all starting to come together and we're looking a lot better."

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Steve Kerr apologizes for argument with Draymond Green.

title: Patriots List 15 Players On Injury Report Ahead Of Jets Game
description: The New England Patriots have a chance to clinch the AFC East in Week 17, but may be shorthanded. The Patriots listed 15 players on Wednesday‚Äôs injury report. Of those 15 players, eight did not participate at all. The following players did not participate in practice: TreVeyon Henderson, DeMario Douglas, Morgan Moses, Thayer Munford Jr., [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The New England Patriots have a chance to clinch the AFC East in Week 17, but may be shorthanded.

The Patriots listed 15 players on Wednesday‚Äôs injury report. Of those 15 players, eight did not participate at all. The following players did not participate in practice:

TreVeyon Henderson, DeMario Douglas, Morgan Moses, Thayer Munford Jr., Milton Williams, Anfernee Jennings and Charles Woods were listed as limited participants. Williams‚Äôs 21-day practice window is open, and the Patriots can activate him at any point.

Not only is the Patriots‚Äô Wednesday injury report long, but it also features some of the most important players on the team. With Hollins, Boutte and Douglas all on the injury report, the Patriots could be thin in the wide receiver room for their game against the New York Jets.

The Patriots could lean on rookie wide receiver Kyle Williams more this week. He has proven he can make big plays this season, and needs just one more 30-plus yard touchdown to tie Randy Moss‚Äôs franchise record for 30-plus yard touchdowns in a single season.

If Wilson is unable to play, Ben Brown figures to draw another start. Spillane has not played since Dec. 1 against the New York Giants. Williams is unlikely to be activated this week, but his limited participation is a good sign that he will be ready to go when the playoffs start.

The Patriots can clinch the division and at least one home playoff game with a win and a Buffalo Bills loss or tie. The Patriots can also clinch the division if they tie and the Bills lose.

title: FIU vs UTSA Prediction, Picks & Odds for December 26 ‚Äî First Responder Bowl
description: Our FIU vs. UTSA predictions expect the battle-tested Roadrunners to rise to the occasion in the First Responder Bowl.
fullText:
We should be in for an entertaining matchup on Friday night when the Florida International Panthers meet the UTSA Roadrunners in the First Responder Bowl.

The Panthers are playing in their first bowl game in six years, and just their sixth since the program‚Äôs inception in 2002, but getting their third bowl victory ever will be difficult against this Roadrunners offense.

See why I like the Roadrunners to get the job done in my Florida International vs. UTSA predictions and college football picks for Friday night‚Äôs First Responder Bowl!

UTSA is the better team, with the better quarterback and the more effective defense. The Roadrunners will utilize their ground game and limit FIU‚Äôs scoring opportunities en route to a win.

It makes sense to look at the 7-5 record for the Florida International Panthers, compared to the UTSA Roadrunners' mark of 6-6, and assume they might be a bit better.

However, according to Jeff Sagarin, the Panthers played a weaker strength of schedule this season than Illinois State and North Dakota.

And if you‚Äôre thinking neither of those is an FBS school, then you‚Äôd be correct.

Despite facing such a weak schedule, the Panthers rank 104th in offensive EPA, 103rd in rushing success, and 105th in rushing defense success rate. They also allow 3.77 points per quality drive, ranking 94th in FBS.

That‚Äôs what happens when you get dominated at the line of scrimmage on defense. The Panthers allow the third-most yards before contact of any FBS team, giving up 2.87 line yards. They also generate little pressure without blitzing heavily.

That‚Äôs great news for a UTSA offensive line that ranks 29th in line yards and 34th in pressure rate allowed. Their backs also rank 20th in yards after contact in the ground game, which is why they‚Äôre 43rd in EPA/rush.

Owen McCown is the better quarterback in this game, and he threw for 370 yards and four touchdowns as he led the Roadrunners to an upset win over Tulane. That‚Äôs by far a better win than any FIU posted this season.

The FIU defense ranks in the 100s in explosive run rate allowed, early down EPA, and stuff rate. Its offense posts very few explosive pass plays, struggles on third down, and is among the most penalized in college football.

UTSA played a tougher schedule, and yet still posted far better metrics on offense and defense. I‚Äôll take the team with the better roster, even with some defections, laying less than a touchdown.

The UTSA offense can put up explosive plays, especially against this FIU defense. It‚Äôs a big reason why the Over is 6-1 in the last seven games for the Roadrunners as they‚Äôve averaged 37 points over that span.

And while FIU‚Äôs not as good as UTSA, that‚Äôs not to say the Panthers won‚Äôt light up the scoreboard themselves. The Over has cashed in three of their last four as they‚Äôve scored 34+ in all three of those contests.

As good as UTSA plays on the whole, the Roadrunners have allowed 34 plays of at least 30 yards this season. FIU has shown an ability to hit big runs, despite the iffy line play, and USF rushed for 7.4 yards a pop against UTSA earlier this season.

It might take some garbage-time offense, but even at 59.5, I think the total is a bit lower than it should be.

Moneyline: FIU +200 | UTSA -250

Over/Under: Over 59.5 | Under 59.5

UTSA has cashed the first-half Over in six of their last seven games for +4.90 units and a 62% ROI. Find more college football betting trends for FIU vs UTSA.

Gerald J. Ford Stadium, Dallas, TX

Monitor gametime conditions with our College football weather info.

Odds are correct at the time of publishing and are subject to change.
